BEGINCONTEXT
url: https://www.historic-uk.com/HistoryUK/HistoryofEngland/The-Great-Fire-of-London/
ENDCONTEXT
The Great Fire of London occurred in September 1666 and lasted for four days. It started in a bakery on Pudding Lane and quickly spread across the city, destroying more than 13,000 houses and numerous public buildings. Remarkably, only six people were recorded as having died in the fire. 

ENDINPUT
BEGININSTRUCTION
When did the Great Fire of London occur, where did it start, and how many people died?
Source?
ENDINSTRUCTION

The Great Fire of London occurred in September 1666. It started in a bakery on Pudding Lane and tragically, only six people were recorded as having died in the fire.

Source: https://www.historic-uk.com/HistoryUK/HistoryofEngland/The-Great-Fire-of-London/
